thread.title: Yahoo boss searches Google for help as profits disappoint
thread.title_full: Yahoo boss searches Google for help as profits disappoint

title: Yahoo boss searches Google for help as profits disappoint
text:
Yahoo boss searches Google for help as profits disappoint Marissa Mayer has struggled to reignite growth in Yahoo Ethan Miller/Getty Images Alexandra Frean US Business Editor   
Marissa Mayer, chief executive of Yahoo, announced last night that she had turned to her old employer Google to help revive her company’s flagging fortunes. 
Posting disappointing quarterly earnings, she revealed an agreement with the search engine giant under which Google will pay Yahoo a slice of advertising revenue in return for sending traffic to its rival. 
While this may bring some value back to Yahoo, it is unclear whether it will be sufficient to offset the company’s mounting problems, which include a year-long decline in its stock value and a massive brain drain. 
The problems were underpinned last night   
Marissa Mayer, whose pay package last year was worth an estimated $42 million, has no intention of taking the usual... Last updated at September 2 2015
